pgTitle: List of disasters in the United States by death toll

rows.text: Deadliest road accident in U.S. history
F5 tornado killed 26 and wounded approximately 500
21 Executed for "Witchcraft," 3 died in jail due to neglect.
plunged over embankment, carrying senior citizens from casino
Cal Poly football team plane crash
Schoolgirls trapped behind exit door; resulted in first city law requiring that exit doors open outward
Damages are out-of-court settlements only; repairs took 133 man-months
19 firefighters were killed trapped when they became trapped in the fast-spreading fire
13 killed in La Plata Elementary School
en route to Connecticut casino, March 12
Bus drove across drawbridge when it was open.
Bus carrying Boy Scouts overturned climbing steep hill.
Collapsed on August 1 at 6:05 PM during rush hour while resurfacing in progress. An additional 111+ injured.
The deadliest two-car auto crash in U.S. history at the time.
Caused by a blowout on April 20. 17 injuries. Subsequent oil spill regarded as worst environmental disaster in US history.
At least 70 people injured in the disaster. Third-deadliest airshow disaster in U.S. history.
A flashover and structural collapse contributed to the deaths of nine Charleston firefighters.

Original collapse on August 6 at 2:48 AM MDT, 6 miners missing. On August 16 at 6:30 PM MDT, 9 rescue workers caught in second collapse while trying to get to trapped miners. Three rescue workers pronounced dead; other 6 injured.
Approximately 80 injuries; deadliest subway train accident US history
The first in-flight deaths in the U.S. Space Program
14 other people were injured, 1 seriously. During the disaster, at least ten people were trapped under the rubble.
Includes the gunman who killed himself; 21 people were injured
Six firefighters lost their lives while searching for two homeless victims, they are now commonly referred to as the Worcester 6

3 immediate fatalities; 2 more people (including one of the perpetrators) were killed a few days later. An additional 264 people were injured by two separate bombings, which were 13 seconds apart. 17 others were injured in a gunfight a few days later (16 police officers and the other perpetrator).

7 people swept out to sea, 1 fatality. Major damage to harbors, especially in Crescent City and Santa Cruz, California with tsunami waves reaching 8.1 feet. Extensive damage also reported in three Hawaiian islands, with tsunami waves up to 12 feet high.
